Before knowing about the mining sector in Africa, we should know what is MINING?

Removal of minerals and metals from the earth is known as Mining. Some examples of what is mined are Copper, Manganese, tantalum, tin, nickel, bauxite, iron ore, gold, silver, and diamonds.

The mining sector consists of large multinational companies that are sustained by production from their mining operations. Several other industries such as equipment manufacture, environmental testing, and metallurgy analysis rely on and support the mining industry all over the world.

Africa has a large number of natural resources which including diamonds, cobalt, oil, natural gas, copper, and gold. This section will detail the broad range of natural resources and how they are mined, processed, and utilized.

Natural resources from Africa have unlimited practical applications, including industrial, manufacturing, medical, energy, and infrastructure development.

The materials we will observe here are all mined in Africa and are ever-present across the continent, they are largely supplied. From Nigeria to South Africa, Egypt to Ghana and everywhere in between, African resources are gaining increasing value in a world fuelled by commodity consumption.

Mining Facts about Africa

1. 55% of the world’s diamonds led by Bostawa & Congo

2. There are over 110 listed mining companies with operations in South Africa.

3. 22% of Africa produces about 483 tons of gold.

4. 60% of the mining in Africa is gold mining.

5. 30% of Africa hosts 30% of the world’s mineral reserves.

Integrated Mining Solution at AVS International

The rise in infrastructure development and automotive production has been driving growth in the mining sector over the last decade. Apart from the Minerals & Metal industries, Power & Cement industries are also aiding growth in the mining sector. We have been simultaneously expanding our reach.

Our Projects

• We have branched out our mining division with projects in the African countries like Zambia, Kenya, and Ghana, taken care of by wholly-owned subsidiaries AVS Kenya & AVS Ghana.

• We have built close ties by supplying quality heavy-duty vehicles and equipment to its government and eventually establishing a business vertical solely dedicated to mining in Zambia.

• We also provide consultancy services to the various government(s) and companies in this specialized segment.

• We engage in sales of specialized vehicles such as fire trucks, dozers, motor graders, excavators, loaders, compactors, and other heavy-duty equipment.

• We believe in prioritizing safety at all our assets; as we seek to minimize our impacts on the environment and communities; and aim to be leaders of today and tomorrow.

Our operations comprise around the mining and metallurgical sites in the African continent. Our purpose is to allocate the sources responsibly as we head to the future.

We fulfil our purpose by delivering on our strategy to be active at every stage of the commodity supply chain. Our prospects lie in the diversity of geography, production, create authentic products, and build value for the business and its diverse stakeholders.
